intro: Solanum sakarense, commonly known as the Sakarénsis nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its berries, which are toxic to humans, are an important food source for certain wildlife species. Solanum sakarense is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
